Based on your preferences, I would recommend the movie "The Skull". This film stars George Coulouris, Peter Cushing, Michael Gough, Christopher Lee and has a runtime of 87 minutes.
"The Skull" is a classic example of the genre of war films. This film tells the story of Tommy Riley who moves with his dad to Chicago from a 'nice place' . He keeps to himself, goes to school. However, after a street fight he is noticed and quickly falls into the world of illegal underground boxing - where punches can kill.
The cast of this film includes some of the most iconic actors in cinema history such as George Coulouris, Peter Cushing, Michael Gough, Christopher Lee and many more.

Based on the preferences you've given, I would recommend "The Odyssey" by Homer.

This epic poem tells the complete story of The Odyssey, Homer's epic in 24 chapters.

The epic hints at what it might mean to travel to wage war, to then try to return to a point of departure, and to have both left behind and carried home chaos.
